content.webTitle: Rock Against Racism defines punk politics

fields.headline: Rock Against Racism defines punk politics
fields.bodyText: A group of activist artists were already bothered by the rise of the far right when Eric Clapton's boozy onstage endorsement of Enoch Powell spurred them to found Rock Against Racism. Described by co-founder Red Saunders as "a raggedy arsed united front", it spanned punk, reggae and beyond. Headlined by Tom Robinson and the Clash, the April 1978 carnival in east London's Victoria Park was its high-water mark. According to Billy Bragg: "It was the moment when my generation took sides."
